intro: Erica curvifolia var. curvifolia, commonly known as the curl-leaved heath, is a species of flowering plant in the Ericaceae family. It is native to the coastal regions of South Africa, particularly in the Western Cape. This evergreen shrub typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring dense, leathery leaves that curve inward. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, and purple, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and requires full sun to partial shade.
